com.sillysoft.lux

Class RandomMapGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sillysoft.lux.RandomMapGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LuxMapGenerator

    public class RandomMapGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements LuxMapGenerator
    RandomMapGenerator is an implementation of the MapGenerator interface.
    It is used to create the built-in random maps in Lux.

    Sometimes described as "potato blob" output. The general strategy is as follows:

    - Pick a width and height to use as the 2D field.
    - Pick a random point inside the field. This will serve as a centerpoint of a country.
    - Using polar co-ordinates, a randomly changing radius is drawn around the center to select the points that form into a country.
    -- Pick a point near outside of the country we just drew.
    -- Use this point as a centerpoint of another country. When a newly created point falls inside a previous shape move the point to follow outside the border of that country.
    -- Repeat picking nearby points and drawing countries for a while. This will form a continent of countries.
    - Then start fresh by picking a brand new point on the field. If inside another country pick again. Start a country around it and more countries near it. Repeat this a few times to grow some continents.

    - After the desired number of countries have been created then countries distance are compared. If they are close enough they connect.

    - More connections (along with lines indicating them) are then made over the board so that all the countries are connected.

      • getChoices

        public java.util.List getChoices()
        Description copied from interface: LuxMapGenerator
        Return a List of Strings giving the different map styles this generator can do. Example: 

        public List getChoices()
        {
        if (choices == null)
                {
                choices = new Vector();
                choices.add("tiny");
                choices.add("small");
                choices.add("medium");
                choices.add("large");
                choices.add("huge");
                }
        return choices;
        }
        Specified by:
        getChoices in interface LuxMapGenerator
        See Also:
        List

      • generate

        public boolean generate(java.io.PrintWriter out,
               java.lang.String choice,
               int seed,
               MapLoader loader)
        Description copied from interface: LuxMapGenerator
        Generate a map of the given 'choice' and output it to the given PrintWriter. Use choice as the style. The seed is be a unique number that identifies the map. Use it to seed your random number generator. The map file should be printed onto the given PrintWriter. Most likely using one of the methods:

            void print(String s)
            void println(String s)

        The given MapLoader has two methods of interest.

            void setLoadText(String text) - will display words where the board will go when not using a cached-map.

        static String getMapGeneratorPath() - can be used to obtain the folder path of where MapGenerators are stored on the local filesystem.

        This method should return true on success. If an error ocurs then false should be returned and a message to stdout should be printed.

        Specified by:
        generate in interface LuxMapGenerator
        See Also:
        PrintWriter, MapLoader

      • canCache

        public boolean canCache()
        Description copied from interface: LuxMapGenerator
        Is Lux allowed to create and cache maps from this generator. This should always be 'true' when distributing a generator since it speeds up the experience of the user. This method is provided so that developers can turn off caching while creating their LuxMapGenerator in order to make testing easier. When created, cached files can be found in Boards/Random/ of your support folder.
        Specified by:
        canCache in interface LuxMapGenerator
